comments:
PHYS361 is an intermediate course in electromagnetism. Topics include
electrostatics, static potential theory, multi-pole expansions, Laplace’s equation, image
solutions, fields in polarized matter, and magneto-statics.
Students across the board greatly enjoyed the class calling it “fulfilling” and one
of the best they have ever taken. Because of the depth and complexity of the material,
most students felt that they grew from the experience. One student remarked, “I am
smarter and better at physics as a result of this course.”
Professor Mele received superlative reviews from all of his students. Students
described him as “gifted” and “inspiring.” Virtually every student commented on
Professor Mele’s unique ability to clarify very abstract subject matter.
The class is primarily composed of undergraduate physics majors as well as
graduate students in the Medical Physics Program. Professor Mele does not grade the
class on a curve.
